Description: Unidentified artefact made of a translucent stone, probably quartz, roughly cut in the shape of a narrow rectangular pyrarmidion truncated at the top. Numerous scuffs on every side, particularly slanting on both opposite largest sides. Possibly an unfinished seal or weight.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but certainly from Tell Dafana: it is the "seal-stone" "of white crystallized calcite" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70, pl. xli, 75, "block for a seal; white calcite", see ibid., p. 111.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70, p. 111, pl. xli, 75)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.67, p.182, pl.24)
